name: The Heathman Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in hotel for three nights with two other couples. Service was excellent and the food was very good. Staff was very attentive. One woman at the front desk staff has a very distinctive voice and a teriffic memory for the names of people; too bad I could not remember her name. Lots of little extras like eyeshades and ear plugs. Of note, the shower handle is of european style, meaning one needs to pull the handle out before the water would run. Would definitely return.

reviews.text: I stayed one night at The Heathman for a business trip. The staff was excellent - every person I encountered made me feel welcome. I requested a room on the same floor as a colleague and the person at check in made an effort to get me as close as possible which was across the hall. My room was a king and as others have mentioned not large. The bathroom was in an interesting arrangement. On one side of the entry hall was a room with the toilet, sink, tub and shower, all nice size. On the other side of the entry was a narrow room with another sink and the closet. The room was comfortable and clean with great amenities. I loved the coffee service. I did get a chance to see my colleague's room. She had 2 double beds and the room was much larger with a sitting area. The bathroom was larger, as well. We went to the library for the wine tasting. It wasn't crowded, the host was very friendly and we sat for an hour or more. The was no stingyness on the wine - he kept our glasses full! The hotel is in a great location, easy walking to Pioneer Courthouse Square, restaurants and shopping. I will definitely return.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Rooms are decorated in muted colors, good beds. Our room was small, tho bath was large. Others reported very small baths. Hotel has limited amenities/facilities-no pool, very small workout room, minibar but no refrig or microwave. Parking is costly
reviews.title: Comfortable and well-located, tho rooms can be small

reviews.text: The room was well appointed, the bed super comfortable. The bathroom was clean and well stocked with great toiletries. The room service was great and even the mini bar wine was fantastic. The only downside was that the heat didn't work. When I notified the front desk, maintenance arrived within five minutes with a super efficient space heater. I recommend staying here - great place to stay.
reviews.title: Great bed, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had made arrangements for our stay at The Heathman through Travel Portland's website as it was listed as one of the Portland Perks hotels. What a perk it is. This has to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The welcoming smiles started from the moment we arrive and continued throughout our stay until we left 5 days later. Not only was the staff very friendly, very knowledgeable, and pleasant, they remembered our names each and every time we interacted with them. Thet certainly live up to their motto "Where Service is still an Art". I would definitely stay here again and again, and again!
reviews.title: The Best Hotel In Portland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Historic hotel with an eco-friendly environment. The young staff is superb: well trained, informative, and always helpful. Our superior king was clean and large, with comfortable chairs along with great bed. But, the room feels old-fashioned: heavy furniture, dark colors, and poor lighting, even next to the beds. The windows open, though; pressed coffee is a treat; the amenities are plentiful and useful; and we slept quietly on the 10th floor although trash collectors (?) on Sat. morning made quite a fuss. I looked at other more trendy hotels, normally our choice, but the service comments were typically spotty. Can't say that about the Heathman.
reviews.title: Cadillac (not a BMW)
Certified eco-friendly and historic charm!"
reviews.text: Hotel restaurants tend to be mediocre but this hotel has an excellent one. My eggs Benedict with crab included a very light hollandaise sauce that was remarkable. Great fresh fruit, juice and rich coffee with very attentive service. Check out the menu - it is varied and along with my guests, we were all happy with our choices.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was able to get a deal that included valet parking. We used public transportation the entire visit and saw quite a bit, as first-time tourists. The Japanese garden was serene and a treat to the eyes. The Rose garden was garish and opulent and ever so amazing. We actually walked to the Sat. market from the hotel, and enjoyed the music along with the crafts and food. It's quite a scene and gives you a flavor for the laid-back culture of the city.
reviews.title: My favorite Portland hotel - pricey but wonderful

reviews.text: Portland is a very eco-friendly city and The Heathman shows that you can be green at a great historic hotel. The hotel was recently certified by Green Seal, a nonprofit that verifies that hotels are really using green practices like energy-saving, recycling and so on. Here's where you can learn more: www.greentravelerguides.com/2011/07/green-hotel-portland-heathman/
reviews.title: Our choice in the future!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Heathman Hotel is a AAA 4-Diamond Hotel on Broadway in downtown Portland. It's a Portland landmark, having been standing in the same spot for some 80 years or so, but has been renovated and kept nice. We've been there several times before, and you always think it's going to be stuffy and old, but it never is. More like a boutique hotel actually, these days. Nice size rooms for the price, a great location, well kept and high levels of service and dining keeps it buzzing all the time.
reviews.title: Still Classy and Cozy After All These Years

reviews.text: LOCATION - Right on Broadway, next door to the Arlene Schnitzer Concert Hall, and only a couple blocks from Pioneer Courthouse Square, the Heathman is perfectly located for a visit to Portland's cultural scene. The streetcar is only a couple blocks away, and there are many excellent restaurants and bars within a short walk. The freeway entrance is about 2-3 blocks too, for easy access off I-405. It's about 7-8 blocks to the waterfront, still walkable. Just down the hill from the Zoo, Children's Museum and Forestry Center, and only about a 2 minute taxi ride to the trendy Pearl District. One of the best located hotels in Portland.
reviews.title: Great location, wonderful staff and very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS - We started out with a Renaissance Suite that we got through Expedia for a steal at $134/night. Big room, about 600 square feet, and well decorated in the old world style. Two bathrooms, one of them huge. Great comfortable featherbed and large sitting area. Desk and a nice view of trees etc. The only problem was that there was some problem with our bathroom - plugged drain or something - that made it smell awful. They couldn't move us out the first night, but moved us to the Andy Warhol suite the next night. It was quite the place - purple velour, leopard prints, green shag carpet, even a Warhol wig and feather boa to play dress-up with (oh my). Very flamboyant, but also very comfortable - the shag carpet was like having a constant foot massage, and the Tempur Pedic bed made for some great nights sleep. Partial view of Mt. Hood through the buildings. Very comfortable, all the amenities you'd want and a great value.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience Ever

reviews.text: SERVICE - The service at the Heathman was superb throughout. The doorman was always there to hold the door for you or help you with any bags, the front desk was always friendly and responsive. They took care of our bathroom problem as well as we could have asked and always warm and hospitable. The restaurant service was not quite as good, but still good.
reviews.title: Great for a family with older teens for eldest grad!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: AMENITIES - Valet parking is a whopping $29.00 per night, but that is pretty standard for downtown Portland. Wireless and Wired internet access was free at 768 kb/s, or you could pay $9.95/day for 1.5 Mb/s access if you chose to. Pool, workout room, nice tea room where they had live jazz on the first night we were there. Bar and Restaurant are classy, and food is good albeit expensive. Happy Hour at the bar has a few good items like a $4.95 burger and a $5.00 cellar special on wine. Restaurant served excellent breakfast - we enjoyed the fresh made hazelnut granola, yogurt and fruit and french press coffee in the room every morning.
reviews.title: Elegant (but older) hotel with excellent service

description: The Heathman Hotel is a member of Preferred Hotels & Resorts Worldwide and Historic Hotels of America. The acclaimed Heathman Hotel is situated downtown in the heart of Portland Oregon's Financial and Cultural Districts. This sophisticated boutique hotel offers luxurious accommodations and award winning service- a refreshing blend of Portland History and Modern hospitality.
